Eener HR is working with a rapidly growing manufacturer in the Little Rock, AR area. We are seeking a Regional Human Resource Manager who will also support the on-site Health, Safety & Environmental (HS&E) function. We are looking for an individual who can be both strategic and hands-on. The role is critical in driving HR functional excellence and process improvement while working towards a world-class HSE program.
The organization provides competitive pay, benefits, and is open to providing relocation.
Responsibilities:
Ensures the company meets legal requirements and government reporting regulations.
Assists managers with recruiting, interviewing, screening, selecting, and hiring qualified employees to fill vacant positions.
Oversees new employee orientation & the on-boarding process to foster positive attitudes and better trained/prepared new-hires.
Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues.
Identifying environmental, health & safety risks and hazards in the workplace and implementing prevention programs.
Advise site leaders and employees on minimizing hazards in the workplace and improving environmental, health & safety performance.
Develop, implement, and maintain effective systems and procedures to achieve an accident and environmental incident-free plant.
Report on safety, recordable, near-misses, first aid, etc. Publish monthly KPIs.
Facilitate safety meetings and safety communications. Conduct weekly safety walk-throughs of all departments.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in a related field, or equivalent work experience. MBA preferred.
Professional SHRM certification is preferred.
5+ years of relevant HR experience within a manufacturing environment.
Certification as a Certified Safety Professional and an OSHA 30-hour training card is a plus.
Knowledge of HSE tools and methodologies.
Strong customer service orientation and proven ability to lead through collaboration, positive interpersonal skills, problem resolution, and a desire to do the right thing.
Successful experience improving company culture, employee relations, communications, and policies.
Proficient computer skills (HRIS, Microsoft Office Suite, etc.).
Knowledge of state and federal employment laws relating to key areas of responsibility.
Maintains confidentiality and high ethical standards.
Ability to develop strong, trusting relationships to gain support and achieve results.
Manage multiple conflicting priorities.
Flexible and available to interact with employees at all levels.
Self- directed and motivated.
Must be willing to work irregular schedules, including some evenings/nights and weekends.
Willingness to travel approximately 20% of the time.

GENERAL JOB SUMMARY: ().Functions as a generalist in a variety of Human Resources activities, with emphasis on participating and/or leading HR related projects. Typically serves in an organization where specialists are not fully deployed. Responsibilities encompass a multitude of activities including: talent acquisition activities, counseling employees and management concerning work-related problems, conducting termination activities, and providing feedback to management when necessary. Supports company’s diversity initiatives and maintain records for EEO and affirmative action reporting requirements. Conducts research and analyzes data on assigned projects. May assist in the formulation and delivery of training materials, workforce planning, performance management, personnel policies and procedures.:KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:
Job Description
This is a temp to hire position
HR Projects
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Working on projects and project-related duties comprise up to approximately 80% of the job.
Executing project tasks as assigned.
Participates in HR projects, up to and including project management.
May work on more than one project simultaneously.
May include developing detailed, comprehensive project plans, and delivering on related tasks according to the established timeline(s).
HR Generalist Duties
Generalist duties comprises approximately 20% of the job.
Provide HRIS support by entering all HR data, creating and running reports, and analysis for HR management.
Coordinate and lead new employee orientations.
Maintain personnel files and other Human Resources records; ensures files are maintained in accordance with legal requirements and Company policies and procedures.
Perform recruiting functions for multiple functional units/offices and to include posting positions, resume review, phone screens, interview set up, and candidate follow up.

Works with the Benefits Department in preparation of employee leaves of absence.
Assists in the delivery, execution and coordination of the annual salary planning, performance evaluations, and other relative projects.
Assist HR Leads in generating spreadsheet calibration of proposed annual rate increases and completing annual data entry of pay increases.
Assists with corporate and business unit wide training initiatives.
Experience And Skills
Must have effective interpersonal and customer service skills and able to interact with all levels of employees and management.

Effective oral and written communication skills.
Effective problem solving skills.
Proficient computer skills to include Microsoft Office, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, IE, and/or Chrome.

Bachelor's Degree in Business or Human Resources, or equivalent experience in Human Resources.
Minimum 2-5 years progressive experience in Human Resources.

Cash App is the fastest growing financial brand in the world. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic app with over 24 million monthly active users. We are bringing a better way to send, spend, invest, and save to anyone who has ever sought an alternative to the traditional banking system.Loved by customers and pop culture, we’ve consistently held the top spot for finance in the App Store for many years, seeing more engagement with millions of followers across social media in a day than most brands see in a year. We are building an ecosystem to redefine the world’s relationship with money by making it universally accessible.We want to hire the best talent regardless of location. Our employment model is distributed, offering the opportunity to collaborate with teams across the world in San Francisco, New York, St. Louis, Portland, Toronto, Kitchener-Waterloo, Sydney, and Melbourne.Interested in learning more?There’s no place like Cash App.HR Business Partners at Cash App are there when our employees need us - and when they don’t. This means that we show up for our teams when they need our help with employee relations, conflict management and coaching/development conversations. It also means that we are prepared to answer their questions before they are asked. To do this, we conduct proactive analysis and data collection, follow up on key issues to help drive accountability and commit to bigger, more complex projects that drive the business forward. We operate with integrity, explain the why behind our actions, and do our very best to drop the HR jargon (HRRs, HRIS and RIFs, anyone?) and lead with sound judgement and common sense approaches to problem solving.The HR Business Partner in this role will be responsible for support of the Engineering and Data Science functions. You are interested in making a significant impact in one of the most valued and visible groups in the company and have an extraordinary desire to innovate. You will report to the Cash HR Lead and work with business leaders to provide hands-on input, insight, and advice. You’re comfortable speaking up and driving forward despite unexpected roadblocks (like, you know, a global pandemic).QualificationsAdditional InformationCash App treats all employees and job applicants equally. Every decision is based on merit, qualifications, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with each office’s corresponding local guidelines.
Company Description
Job Description
You Will
Partner with managers of all levels to develop and implement HR policies and practices to support the strategic growth of the business
Offer expertise regarding organizational and people-related strategy and execution
Provide information and education for all levels of the organization on HR issues
Educate and partner with managers on performance management and employee development goals
Provide HR expertise in the areas of feedback, employee relations, coaching, and organizational development
Help develop HR programs, such as recruiting, retention, compensation, benefits, and Learning & Development
Collaborate with HR team to champion and accelerate a culture in which people feel engaged and inspired to achieve top results
Develop people strategies and design approaches for diagnosing and enhancing organizational effectiveness and employee satisfaction
Enable global distribution of teams by partnering with Immigration and Global Mobility to create a seamless experience
Partner on core HR processes (e.g., performance calibration, compensation cycle, promotions)
Analyze employee reports (e.g., compensation, job levels, and attrition) to guide decision-making and provide proactive solutions to client groups
Partner with Learning & Development to work on value-added programs in areas of training, career mobility and job performance
Educate team members on performance feedback practices.
You Have
7+ years of experience in a strategic role on a People/HR team, preferably as a Human Resources Business Partner (a BA/BS degree in a related field is a bonus)
Experience as a strategic partner with dynamic, challenging responsibilities supporting a global team of more than 1,000+ employees (international experience is a bonus)
A history of partnership alignment to build and improve company culture and increase employee engagement
Experience managing multiple large client groups within a fast-growing environment
Ability to effectively collaborate at all levels
A deep knowledge of HR programs and practices, including applicable state and federal employment laws and regulations

Describe my day:
It may sound cliché but there isn't a typical day here. The  responsibilities of this role are diverse and dynamic, but we'll do our  best to give you a taste.

Firstly, it imperative to understand that here at OSH HR is a  function of sales. Our HR team looks a bit different than normal. You  will be integral to the business development process as for us  compliance is the backbone of sales. Every day you will oversee the  onboarding of all caregiving staff while following our very extensive  list of policies and procedures. Sounds simple enough, right? Well, what  this really means is you will be involved in:

Credentialing: We work collaboratively with the entire team to  ensure that all caregivers are always up to date on their required  credentials. This includes, sending out monthly reports to caregivers,  follow up calls, running reports, or even just catching them when they  are in the office.
Training: The HR Dept will ensure that each caregiver is given the  proper training in order to provide the highest level of care to our  consumers both upon hire and annually.
Audits: We conduct audits of caregivers personnel files on a daily,  weekly and monthly basis. This includes checking all trainings, CDC  requirements and OSH forms are correct and up to date.
Onboarding: compliantly hire all external employees, conducting  background checks, screening candidates, and following all internal and  external policies, procedures, and regulations.
Requirements:
What you should bring with you:
We always say here at OSH that we hire character and train skill. So what kind of character do we need?
Someone who:
Knows It's All About the Details. Hires, audits, onboarding  scheduling, etc. You will have your hand in multiple pots and skimping  on details does not fly here.
Has Personality. This seems obvious, but we are a no wallflower  zone. Our culture is a value oriented one where we want characters.

Has Patience for a Middle Name. Or it could be your first name! You  will be dealing with many different personalities and rarely are two  situations ever the same. we need someone who can take that deep breath  and stay professional.
Can Tell Time...And Manage It. This role is largely independent. You  will need to know how to prioritize your schedule and how to accomplish  all your tasks in a timely manner.
Asks Questions. Change is a constant at OSH. We look for people  question the traditional to make us better. We want those who are  solution oriented seekers.
Is empathetic. Our caregivers come from all walks of life and each  has their own unique story. You need to be relatable and understanding.
Isn't A Pushover. As an HRC you will occasionally need to wrangle  our sales team in, reminding them that one thing we don't compromise on  is compliance. Don't worry we'll provide the lassos.
Wants Growth. This is dynamic company with a quick promotion track.  If you are content to linger in one position for years, we are not for  you.
Is Educated. We are smart. We bet you are too, but we want to see your degree as proof.
Loves Driving. Ok you don't have to love it, but you will have to do it from time to time to meet and hire caregivers. **

We currently have an opening for a Human Resource Business Partner Lead. You will lead the talent strategy for several teams within Twitter. This will require you to think strategically about complex people topics that need savvy approaches and roll-up your sleeves to get the work done well. You’ll partner closely across HR team members to understand what already exists for you to use and what you can create based on local or functional needs.Success in this role looks like this You will develop, iterate and execute a people strategy with your client groups - one which is connected to the company, business and HR team objectives. In partnership with the broader HR & Recruiting team to identify needs and use existing resources in creative ways. You will be instinctive enough to jump on critical business issues & opportunities when you see them, fearless enough to get operational items resolved, and savvy enough to work with all levels in a matrixed environment. You will help to elevate management and leadership capacity by truly understanding needs and perspectives. You will build strong, respectful relationships and overcome obstacles with fortitude. You will influence the right outcomes for the business grounded in data, helping to elevate Twitter’s employment brand and distinct culture.Overall, you will play a key role in helping to shape and drive the talent agenda supporting business goals. Specifically, you will work closely with leaders, teams and global HR colleagues to identify people opportunities, strategies and solutions to challenges within the business such asBusinessDevelopersHelp CenterMarketing
What You’ll Do

Coaching and advising on a variety of components impacting employee experience employee relations concerns, first tier investigations, performance management, rewards and recognition, leaves of absence, local labor laws, global mobility, compensation and benefits;
Creating and executing initiatives to drive extraordinary individual and team performance, including integration efforts for newly acquired individuals and companies into Twitter;

Driving executional excellence and change management to broad-based initiatives including talent reviews, inclusion and diversity, workforce planning, talent analytics, and overall process improvements in service to a positive employee experience;

Analyzing people data and trends to identify talent retention solutions in partnership with HR colleagues from Inclusion and Diversity, Talent Acquisition, People Systems and Analytics, Employee Relations, Total Rewards, Legal, Learning and Development and our global HR teams in EMEA, LatAm and APAC;
Employing operational discipline partnering with People Services and Total Rewards to ensure accuracy in organizational hierarchy, pay, titling, and leveling.
Up to 30% domestic travel may be necessary.
Who You Are

You know your stuff – you are an experienced HR professional who can drive talent programs, handle people dynamics and advise on HR policies; but more importantly, you know when to pull in the perspectives of the broader team
You love business, especially technology, and are interested in how businesses drive revenue, navigate challenges and the role talent plays in keeping a competitive edge
Keeping status quo is your worst nightmare; you are motivated by complexity and challenges
You are a high energy person and like fast paced, dynamic environments that evolve before they have to
You are high-reaching and like to win - together. You thrive off of working with smart, creative people that challenge you to perform at a higher level
You are comfortable in ambiguity and can make sound decisions in complex situations
You have a high learning agility and understand people dynamics, new business models and talent processes
If this sounds like it might be you, you probably have
Experience partnering with Marketing or Creative teams
Experience working in a faced paced, high growth, dynamic business environment; tech industry experience highly desired
Consulting background preferred, particularly experience in the areas of HR program delivery and creation
Experience partnering with a global HR team
A solid track record of influencing senior business leaders while demonstrating excellent decision quality
Outstanding interpersonal and influencing skills; demonstrated ability to develop relationships and influence at all levels within the organization
Excellent communication (verbal and written) skills
10+ years as an HR business partner or similar role
BA/BS in business administration, psychology or other related discipline

Farmgirl Flowers is looking for a highly experienced and goal-oriented Head of People and Culture who is inspired and excited to help build a company we’d want to buy from, sell to, and work with. As our Head of People and Culture, you will be a valued member of our senior leadership team, reporting to the CEO. The ideal candidate will be a dynamic, hands-on leader with deep business acumen, strategic insight, sound judgment, positive attitude, and a genuine desire to build the best team culture possible. You will spearhead all initiatives related to key human resources, training, program and policy building, and talent acquisition and retention. This is an opportunity for a nimble and adaptive leader to balance a strategic focus with a “roll up the sleeves” mindset to create, impact, and shape a growing and successful business and its internal culture. We’re looking for a positive and thoughtful self-starter who can take initiative and adapt to evolving circumstances, which is always the case in our bootstrapped, high-growth company. Our company does not look or operate like most in Silicon Valley. The ideal candidate will embrace that and be excited to work in a an operationally intense, scrappy, fast growth manufacturing environment.
About The Role
Farmgirl’s next Head of People and Culture will be excited to have the opportunity to do the following:

--------Build an effective diversity and inclusion training program for the entire team, and intensive, ongoing training for continuous growth for the leadership team (at all levels and locations). --------Work with the CEO and others on the executive leadership team to develop systems and procedures around corporate transparency to alleviate challenges the company is currently experiencing surrounding accountability. --------Create a process where everyone feels comfortable reporting if something happens that makes them feel uncomfortable without fear of retaliation.-------Create a hiring process that attracts diverse candidates and ensures equitability throughout the interview, selection, and feedback process.--------Possibly implement an Employee task force to find out what negative experiences people have had previously and then working on a development plan to help prevent it from happening in the future. --------Help to create an environment where every team member is feels like they are valued and that their differences are celebrated.

Work with the founder/CEO and leadership team to develop a culture of learning and continuous feedback by creating programs, tools, and experiences that engage our team at all levels and inspire a positive, adaptive, and accountable culture. We have 140 total team members, roughly 90% non-exempt and 10% exempt, so our team dynamics are different than most in the Bay Area. We’re working hard to create great non-tech jobs and you’ll be instrumental in helping us continuously work toward that goal by developing and implementing programs that promote growth opportunities and team engagement.

We’re currently experiencing challenges around diversity and inclusion at the company. This is extremely important to us that we correct what we need to and identify what we don’t even know to be our blind spots in this area (and others) so the most pressing goals this position will help to achieve are in this area. The new Head of People and Culture will work with the CEO and other company leaders, as well as an outside contracted company on an overall strategy for how to ensure we are creating a safe and positive place to work for every team member at Farmgirl Flowers. It will include initiatives like the ones below (however this is a starting point, we will be excited to build on this with the person in this role).

You will be the strategy leader for all people, culture, and HR related objectives at the company. If you’re someone who likes to build teams and the positive work environment that they thrive in - and appreciate very limited red tape getting in the way, this role might be a great fit. You’ll be building your team almost from the ground up, adding several more positions to the department in the very near future.

Develop systems and procedures that will allow us to attract and hire the right people, engage and cultivate their talents once hired and remain engaged through team building and retention strategies, as well as ways to develop their skills to allow for advancement opportunities if that’s something they’re interested in pursuing at the company.

Up until this year we operated from one location, but now will be operating from two in the US and two in Ecuador (through farm partners), and possibly more domestically and abroad in the future, as well as a much more remote work experience for many departments including customer service, engineering, marketing, and leadership. This role will be instrumental in helping to build systems to ensure cohesion of the team even while working in multiple locations.

Lead and inspire in all areas of the operation. We’re looking for someone with a high degree of emotional resilience, thoughtfulness, and positivity for this role as you’ll be looked at as a leader amongst the team.

Strengthen our people strategies and programs, including talent recruiting and onboarding, compensation & benefits, policies and compliance, employee engagement and retention strategies, and training and morale initiatives. You’ll work with managers across the organization to ensure we’re creating a great working environment for our entire team – which is our entire team’s goal.
Understand our company goals and align our people practices with our business objectives.
Farmgirl Is Excited About You Because You Have…

We are a successful, profitable, well capitalized, fast-growing companyWe create products that bring joy to hundreds (and sometimes thousands) of people's lives each dayWe lead the industry for product quality and customer serviceWe get to build an amazing company and team built on respect and empowering and supporting one anotherWe're scrappy and get to see the fruits of our labor in real time each and every dayWe believe in autonomy and reward taking initiativeAs a 100% e-commerce business, we are technologically focused and data-drivenWe get to be creative every day and build a great company, without red tape or bureaucracyWe have an amazing team and company culture that you'll love being a part ofWe have an impressively smart and dedicated CEO and management team who are focused on developing all team members in the organizationCompetitive salaries and comprehensive health benefits Our goal is to be a company that we would want to buy from, sell to, and work for. For us, this means doing the right thing even when it is the difficult thing. We live these ideals by providing jobs that pay above the minimum wage with good benefits and 401Ks. We also do this by occasionally taking a stand on what some may consider controversial issues that we feel are important to us both as a business and as people. When we take these stands, we do so under the Farmgirl Flowers brand. As an employee, we understand these views may be associated with you simply by your employment with us. Please understand that when we make public any beliefs we do not expect nor mandate our employees (or potential employees) to ascribe to these beliefs as well. For the sake of transparency, we believe it is important you understand what Farmgirl Flowers stands for as you consider joining our team. Farmgirl Flowers is located in a big, drafty warehouse and we function similarly to a manufacturing facility. The warehouse is raw, open space that can be cold and dirty (especially on busy days). If a posh work space is a priority this might not be ideal for you. Appropriate attire will be expected for this environment.
5+ year’s experience in a People Operations / HR, with recent relevant experience, preferably in a similar workforce industry.
Experience supporting both salaried and hourly workforces, creating relevant and meaningful employee programs, reviews and feedback loop
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate, influence, and work well with team members at all levels
Experience in developing creative recruiting strategies and being strategic to identify and attract top-notch talent in a highly competitive market
Strong communicator with the ability to provide both strategic foresight and feedback

Comprehensive understanding of employment law and compliance, compensation, benefits, organizational development, employee relations, and training. We work with an HR law firm, so you will have as much support as needed in this area.

Well-developed leadership, communications, team building and influencing skills; great with professional boundaries, and the confidence and stature to effectively address sensitive HR and business issues
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail with a knack for accuracy and creative problem-solving skills
Strong time management and critical thinking skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively
A solutions-oriented mindset when faced with challenges and in addressing roadblocks
High social and emotional intelligence - you truly enjoy mentoring team members and cultivating strong relationships with all types of people
Experience establishing relationships as a trusted advisor to executive team members and a safe space for team needs
A stellar work ethic and ability to work independently as well as within a team
You'll love working at Farmgirl because...

The HR Business Partner (HRBP) position is responsible for aligning business objectives with employees and management in designated business units. They will consult with designated business units on all HR operations including employee relations, retention, leave of absence management, benefits administration.The Business Partner will report to the Human Resources Manager and assist the HR Manager/Director of Human Resources in the processing and handling of various HR functions directly related to the Human Resources Department.
Position Summary
Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Builds strong working relationships, demonstrates a high level of integrity, and establishes a proactive approach to customer service.

Provides guidance and support in administering human resources policies and procedures to ensure that employees receive fair and reasonable treatment to establish a supportive work environment and to avoid potential legal liabilities.
Provides first line support for all employees’ inquiries. Addresses and resolves employee relations concern in a timely and responsive manner.

Limits potential risk and exposure to the company by effectively managing and resolving basic and complex employee relations issues through conducting effective, thorough and objective investigations as necessary.
Conducts regular meetings with respective business leaders.
Finds ways to build morale, improve workplace relationships, and boost productivity and retention.
Ensures regulatory compliance with legal requirements pertinent to the day-to-day management of employees; collaborating with HR Director and legal representatives when necessary.
Processes voluntary/involuntary terminations and conducts exit interviews, maintains Exit Survey data through third party, and analyzes reports and shares feedback with management for improvement.
Responds to Employment Development Department requests for unemployment insurance claims. May represent employer at unemployment hearings.
Plans and manages employee engagement events as they are defined and participates in other employee rewards and recognition opportunities.
Assists assigned business units with the sharing of Employee Opinion Survey results and action planning to maintain and improve working conditions.
Responsible for performance management tools and resources. Partner with unit management to ensure that evaluations are maintain and conducted per policy.
Responsbile for maintaining Job Descriptions and working with department management to implement changes.
Responsible for properly managing Alternative Work Schedules and election process.
Responsible for Employer of Choice strategies and initiatives, with the support of HR Manager/Director.
Proactively partners, plans and makes recommendations with members of the management teams, in their client base to help them achieve Employer of Choice.

Provides guidance for employee and management inquires regarding HR policies. Participates in developing the communication and training materials for new or revised HR related program introductions. May participate in presentations.
Tracks and identifies trends in turnover, sharing data with Management. Proactively addresses retention through other appropriate initiatives.
Processes employee status changes transactions such as transfers, reclassifications, promotions, leaves of absence, etc.
Maintains Kronos Human Resources Information System.
Takes an active role in supporting HR compliance processes and implementation, not limited to: Licensure, Survey Readiness, File Auditing, and other compliance related initiatives.
Responsible for the maintanace and compliance of all employee files and HOS files.
Creates and interprets ad hoc and routine reports.
Partner with HR Specialist to ensure License and Certifications are maintained in assigned business units; resolves escalated issues
Ensures compliance for Joint Commission, CDPH, Etc. and Survey readiness. Assists when surveyors are present with data collection and possible presentation.
Partners with Benefits Specialist to plan, organize and conduct benefit information sessions. Sends communication regarding benefits open enrollment and all other related information as needed.
Conducts Payroll and benefits troubleshooting (questions involving rate of pay, benefits deductions and other unresolved issues)

Partners with Leave of Absence Specialist to process and track all Leave of Absence (LOA) requests. Ensures interactive process followed for work restrictions and leave support; resolves escalated issues.
Recommends new approaches, policies and procedures to ensure continual improvements in efficiency within the department of Human Resources.
Attends Human Resources administrative staff meetings.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Position Requirements
Education
Bachelor Degree in Human Resources or other related field; or equivalent combination of relevant education
and experience.
Master’s Degree in Human Resources preferred.
Qualifications/Experience
Minimum of 5 years working experience in a Human Resources Department. Experience supervising/managing employees, or other directly relevant experience preferred.
Must be able to respect and maintain highly confidential information.
The ability to engage in reasoned dialogue on complex, difficult, or emotional issues, to be flexible, actively listen, and affect change.
Able to give constructive feedback in a supportive manner
Effectively work independently and as a member of a team, quickly build strong working relationships, demonstrate a high-level of integrity, and establish a proactive approach to customer service.
Ability to pay attention to detail with excellent prioritization and organization skills.
Self-starter with strong project management skills and ability to follow through.
Demonstrated adaptability and flexibility to changes and response to new ideas and approaches.
Special Skills/Knowledge
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Working knowledge of Kronos is a plus.
Possess intermediate math skills excellent written and verbal communication skills.
